title: "Great Support & great tool!"
description:
What do you like best about Close?I have been using Close for about 10 months now in Sales. Like any software in the world, issues can arise, but what I can say is that the level of support has been excellent in such situations! 

- The in-tool reporting is smooth & immediate,
- I always got fast answers by email and direct contact with the support team,
- Additionally, my company also has an account manager at Close, in case of bigger issues/escalations. 
> At all times, we know we won't be left hanging which is very reassuring. 

All of the above is also complemented by banners effectively visible on the software itself, whenever an issue is more globalised and worked on - here again, communication is key and if we know, it is already reassuring to read they're on it! What do you dislike about Close?More visibility on the leads from the tasks pannel, directly from the inbox, would an amazing improvement. Even better if it allows us to filter/order, so we can give priority to some tasks over others without having to enter the lead itself. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?As per the previous summary, the level of support has been key.

title: "Best CRM on the market"
description:
What do you like best about Close?I Record/Produce music. Close has been a game changer in that I can easily keep track of all of my conversations with literally hundreds of potential clients and automate reminders to follow up with them ensuring that I stay top of mind. Freeing up my brain and easing my anxiety so that I can focus on being creative. I use it literally every day.

Clients are astonished when I remember their birthdays, family members, and all of the details about projects that they themselves forgot about. 

The GUI is incredibly intuitive and the workflow of it, IMHO, is far superior to any other CRMs. Even ones at much higher price points. I am a small business and the price/features of Close give me the exact tools I need without paying an arm and a leg for more expensive CRMs that give me a ton of features I will never need. It's the perfect balance of a CRM  with incredible customer support as well. 

Close has easily helped me double my income since I implemented it. It's one of those things where I have no idea how I used to live without. What do you dislike about Close?I tried to think really hard, but I honestly don't have any complaints about Close. They continue to do updates and bug fixes and their customer support is alway quick, friendly and any issues I have are quickly solved. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close allows me to stay top of mind with potential clients, which has more than doubled my income. It frees my brain and eases my anxiety by automating reminders and keeping track of conversations all in one convenient place, with zero effort in trying to navigate the GUI.

title: "A Great CRM!"
description: What do you like best about Close?Close is my favorite CRM. I've been in sales for many years, and I've used everything, but Close is the best. It's easy to use, I love the powerdialer (great if you have a lot of leads you need to reach!), I love how easy it is to input notes, how organized it is and I love how easy it is to make customized lists to better organize cilents. What do you dislike about Close?Sometimes it's tricky to merge leads, for whatever reason our leads sometimes come in twice (they might have booked months ago and again more recently) and it could be nice if merging them didn't delete everything from one (it's easy to accidentally delete the wrong one, too). That isn't really a big issue, though, I'm just nit-picking because Close is great. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close solves time management issues, especially with outbound sales. It's quite easy to call multiple people in a short time and track at the same time. Close has helped me better understand where prospects are in the pipeline, and I love that each company can customize what their own pipeline looks like. Everything is in one place, emails, SMS, bookings. It's easy to see exactly what has happened with each client individually, too.

title: "The best sales CRM we've ever used"
description:
What do you like best about Close?When it comes to a CRM that helps you manage the sales cycle as a small or medium-sized business, I've not encountered a better system out there. We've tried scores of them over the years including Salesforce (which was massive overkill for what we needed). 

What we've liked best about Close is that it knows what it is and what it is not. We've been on the platform for over 7 years and have worked with them through many iterations of the software and every feature release has been intentional and valuable for our team. 

It integrates seemlessly with our email (Google Enterprise) and we've been able to use their API to integrate with all other platforms necessary along the way. It has extremely powerful reporting, workflows, smart views, task management, pipeline management and more. It's very easy to train new team members how to use it and it gives a magnificent timeline of clients and their interactions with our team.

The Smart Views are probably one of the most valuable features we use with the system as they allow us to ensure that no lead or opportunities get left behind and it makes it easy for sales managers to quickly identify who on the team is behind on their client or prospect communications or follow ups.

The integrated dialer and phone system along with call recording and AI summaries cuts down on the need for the reps to take detailed notes and allows them to more quickly move on to more dollar productive activities.

Their recent mobile app release was something we had been asking for for years and it was a very welcomed addition to the tool as we have a remote sales force. 

Lastly, it's very fast to use. Salesforce (and many others) require too many steps to perform basic activities and the platforms can be slow to load and work in. Close is FAST. Everything is easy to get to and things just load quickly. Our team loves that aspect of it. What do you dislike about Close?Because Close is a sales CRM, you will need separate systems for marketing and fulfillment which means that you will need to have someone on the team versed in systems integrations and who can help maintain clean data between all of your systems. This has gotten so much easier with Close than when we first started with the platform. We had to do a lot of data clean up at times while we figured out how to best manage the synchronization between the different systems.

If you know this going into it, you can prepare in advance to make sure that you've thought through the different triggers in each system that need to fire off updates into Close and from Close into those systems. A great example is when a client's information is updated in a fulfillment system or a marketing system, you need to ensure that Close gets the update rather than a duplicate record getting created or it not getting updated at all.

This also means you need to figure out what information your sales team needs to know about your product or service delivery and make sure that information is fed back into Close so that you don't have information silos that keep sales people in the dark. Again, this can all be managed with proper planning but you need to be aware of it.

The one other thing that took us some time to figure out initially is the way the structure the system around Leads and Contacts. We are more of a B2C operation so the Lead is typically the Contact (but not always). So this created some issues at first because Leads have a one-to-many relationship with Contacts. Meaning, they assumption is that the Lead is a company and the Contacts are those contacts at the Company (Lead) that you interface with. Not the end of the world but certainly something you need to account for if you're working with B2C and B2B like we sometimes do. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It's our Sales CRM and it's been the backbone of our sales operation for years. It's made it so much easier to train and onboard sales people, keep everyone updated on the status of deals, manage our sales teams activity, and ensure that our pipeline is clean and well managed.

title: "Transitioning from HubSpot to Close"
description:
What do you like best about Close?We’ve been using Close.com for a over one year now, and overall, it’s been a very solid CRM for managing our sales pipeline. The setup was relatively straightforward, and the interface is user-friendly, which made onboarding our team easier than expected.

One thing we really appreciate is the integrated email and call tracking—it saves time and keeps everything in one place. Close has definitely helped us stay organized and focused on follow-ups, which has been a game-changer for our sales process. If you’re looking for a CRM that emphasizes simplicity and productivity, it’s worth considering. What do you dislike about Close?The Workflow feature is currently a bit limited overall compared to HubSpot or other CRMs. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Simple to use but still customizable, AI features are great and overall really good to use and focus on actually making calls instead of (like HubSpot) way to much time spent on keeping records up to date.

title: "One of the best CRMs for start-ups"
description:

The notifications of opportunities and tasks are seamless and they appear in a way I don't get overwhelmed if I am doing some different task.

What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Helping us Account Exectives & Customer Success Managers increase customer engagement getting complete overview of past communications. sending automated bulk emails or even single emails right when I am at a lead. I could just choose from the templates and get it sorted. It saves a lot of time by these very needy small features.

title: "Real Estate Investing CRM"
description: What do you like best about Close?Close was the preferred CRM at the company I worked for years ago. title: "Close is GREAT!"

title: "Easy to use but super capable sales-tool"
description:

What i like the most is the beautiful ui, which is much more streamlined than most of the competition. Using close therefore is fun. When i ecountered problems, the mail-support  was quick in helping me.

Maybe an integrated  AI, trained specially for cold mails would be great, i am using Chat GPT for that part. The integrated AI is okay, but not as capable as for example Chat GPT. title: "Essential CRM for Automated Sales Processes"
description: What do you like best about Close?What I appreciate most about Close is its excellent integration capabilities and the robust automation features it offers. It allows for seamless connections with other tools, which is ideal for creating complex, assembly-line-style workflows. Whether it’s capturing, nurturing, or following up with leads, Close adapts flexibly to our unique processes and helps us streamline our workflow to a level that few other CRMs can match. What do you dislike about Close?Initially, I found the user interface a bit challenging to navigate, especially for new users. Additionally, the platform is entirely in English with no options for other language translations, which could be a barrier for non-English-speaking teams. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close serves as a powerful foundation for our sales processes, particularly when combined with enrichment tools and invoicing/onboarding tools. From my own experience, Close has reduced the time required for our sales operations by as much as 70% compared to previous workflows. This increased efficiency has been a significant boost for our team's productivity and results.

title: "Best CRM Software"
description:
What do you like best about Close?What I appreciate most about Close is its intuitive, user-friendly interface that streamlines the sales process. The built-in communication tools—such as calling, SMS, and email—integrated directly into the platform, allow for seamless interaction with leads and clients without the need to switch between multiple applications. Additionally, the automation features, like email sequences and follow-up reminders, significantly reduce manual tasks, enabling me to focus more on closing deals. The robust reporting and analytics tools provide valuable insights into sales performance, helping to identify areas for improvement and track progress effectively. What do you dislike about Close?While Close offers a robust set of features, there are a few areas that could be improved:

Pricing Structure: Some users find Close's pricing relatively high, especially for smaller businesses or startups. While it offers a robust feature set, the cost may be prohibitive for budget-conscious organizations. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close addresses several key challenges in sales management, providing significant benefits:
-Automation of Repetitive Tasks: Features like email sequences and follow-up reminders automate routine tasks, reducing manual effort and allowing me to focus more on building relationships and closing deals.
-Effective Lead Management: Close offers robust lead tracking and customizable pipelines, enabling me to prioritize high-value opportunities and manage the sales process more effectively.

title: "For me, the best CRM on the market."
description: What do you like best about Close?Close is lean, like our business. Most CRMs are completely overloaded and do not focus on what really matters. We work with Close every day and in 2 different areas with the multi-organization license. Close is intuitive and offers EXACTLY THE FUNCTIONS that our team needs day by day. Our entire team (ex-Apple, ex-Mercedes) says there has never been a better CRM in any company.The updates are always on-point and the software receives new features almost monthly, which add even more value. Via Zapier, Close can be integrated into almost any setup excellently and that too without hardcoding! What do you dislike about Close?I can't say much about that. From time to time there are bugs, which the team resolves within a few days and ALWAYS takes seriously. I don't know if that's a disadvantage. In Germany we say: Where there is planing, shavings will fall! What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Pretty much every problem in the B2B sales process. We are a product company, and even here, Close can be applied excellently. Whether it's handovers between teams, documentation of offers, etc. Close is our all-in-one solution!

title: "My favorite CRM"
description:
What do you like best about Close?The platform is highly intuitive and user-friendly, with straightforward CRM tasks that are easy to manage, the smart views are also very usefull.

It's particularly effective for outbound sales campaigns, especially for cold email outreach and cold calling.

I appreciate the reports section, as it enables seamless comparison of statistics with my team, fostering better collaboration and performance insights.

Overall, this is so far the best CRM I have ever worked with. What do you dislike about Close?Almost nothing so far except a few tiny bugs sometimes, but I'm happy with the software and what it offers. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It streamlines my prospecting efforts by allowing me to quickly call leads and efficiently record valuable information to close deals more effectively.

title: "Easier power dialing"
description:
What do you like best about Close?Making the switch to Close has been such a game-changer for us. While we were using old CRM system (which I will not mention lol) power dialing felt like a full-time job in itself, and it wasted so much of our time. With Close, the whole process is way more streamlined and just makes sense for how we work.

Plus, having transcripts built right in is a huge plus. Now we don’t have to mess around with other tools for notes, and it’s super easy to share all the call details with our closers. They go into meetings way better prepared with the info they need on each prospect, and it’s made everything run a lot smoother. Overall, Close has been a breath of fresh air for us! What do you dislike about Close?I don't really know if will be able to match the AI automations we had in our old CRM system, but who knows, I am not a tech guy What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Makes power dialing a lot easier and not so exhausting

title: "Close CRM is the Real Deal!"
description: What do you like best about Close?Close CRM is a simple but powerful platform that is easy to navigate. What I really like is the fact that you can segment your data based on a number of filters. I especially like that I can see who opened my emails so that I can prioritize my follow up with leads that are more likely to convert. What do you dislike about Close?There is not much that I don't like. I wish there was a native integration with data providers like Seamless.ai. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close allows me to sort through a large data set to find prospective clients in a systematic approach. I can tailor my message to the prospect based on the data in Close and automate my follow up. I'm saving so much time and it is much more efficient than other point solutions I've used in the past. In my opinion, Close is the best CRM on the market for this segment.

title: "Bringing Sales to the next Level"
description:

title: "Great CRM for a Small but Growing Company"

With all the customizable fields, Close makes tracking current and potential customers simple.

description:

What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?AI transcripting saves time
Clear picture of the history of a prospective company
I get to spend more time calling & obtaining new business and less time wasted on sluggish CRMs

It integrates super well with my calendar and and any bookings are reflecting in the contact. However I do use Close for my personal business as well which is under this email)

title: "Account Exec"
description:
What do you like best about Close?I've been using Close.io for over 4 years now and I love it's simplicty. Best CRM for sales and pipeline management. Easy to use and the quick resposne from the their support team is invaluable What do you dislike about Close?I'm not a fan of the smartview folders and the filters available when I'm trying to segment data. I would love to see smartview folders similar to a zip folder. The issue is that I have 20 smartview folders for 20 different items when it'd be helpful to catorgoize sub folders within a single one.

This will help reduce chaos along the left side of my screen and other users that share the database. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Chaos Management. 

I'm at peace knowing I can go on PTO for 2 weeks and come back to a poluted inbox that's easy to handle.

title: "Incredible Sales CRM"
description: What do you like best about Close?The flexibility to customize leads and the integration of all unique lead communication in one place (i.e. emails, calls, notes, files, etc.). Incredibly helpful sales platform that really helps organize and document relationship history. Truly love this platform and makes my job so much easier! What do you dislike about Close?The only issue I have experienced has been issues with call quality, where there has been static on the receiving end of the line. Mobile app interface also doesn't refresh very frequently and need to backout to update. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close is the heart of our sales organization, helping us stay organized with leads and track our pipeline. It's the ultimate organization and documentation nucleus.

title: "The first intuitive CRM system I like to work with!"
description: What do you like best about Close?Email, sms, calls, meetings are all integrated and the full history of communication is shown in one clear screen. I love the workflows you can set up and enroll prospects in with email templates and activities. Search function is bringing you where you need to go fast and pipeline, reports and smartviews are very helpfull. Most of all it all makes sense from minute one and you don't need days of training or hours of research to get used to the system. What do you dislike about Close?Adding a phonenumber is costly if you need a Dutch number What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Tracking of oppertunity status and communication. Automated mail campaigns and more it saves me a great deal of time so I can focus more on other sales activities and get more done.

title: "Its pretty good for me as an appointment setter makes everything easier but there are some issues"
description: What do you like best about Close?i think the most helpful is that you could auto dial it makes it better and I like the recording call feature and the task feature to schedule calls and that im able to take notes while on calls with leads What do you dislike about Close?I dont like the auto dialer doesnt double dial and has some issues where calls randomly hang up sometimes or wont load the next leads as fast so its tough to reach out sometimes since I dont know who im adressing What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It helps with being more effeient and organized since it emails you as well and its pretty easy to use to get a hang of if your a newer user

title: "Best CRM for High Ticket Selling"
description:
What do you like best about Close?Whether you're running a setter/closer model or just a sales model Close is pretty awesome. It's integration with Google and Linkedin + Calendly makes prospect recon easy and management sales calls clean. We've used other systems. Nothing compares. Including big ones like Salesforce. After spending over $10,000 on customizing salesforce, it still didn't cut it. 

We get about 900 leads a month to go through. We were getting about 70% penetration as leads would fall through the cracks. 

Now, my team uses workflows and they can easily control their own leads and we get 100% penetration on all leads. As a manager, the reports show me exactly what I want to see without the bloat. I can listen to calls, see what's happening minute by minute. There's truly nothing like it.

We use it every day. And if we have a question, support is easy to get a hold of. My favorite part about support is the integrating screen recording so I can easily show what my question is and don't have to type a bunch of stuff up. 

We had CLOSE set up 100% and ready to go within 2 weeks. 
That's unheard of with a CRM! 

(And we had 25,000+ contacts to load in) What do you dislike about Close?Not much. The only thing missing would a general task tool where a TASK didn't have to be tied to a lead. Or even integration with Google Tasks would be fine. Other than that. That's it. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?The best CRM is the one you use. And my entire team uses it all day! And our database is clean!

title: "The most intuitive CRM software I have ever tried"
description:
What do you like best about Close?Intuitive, user friendly, great support staff that are quick to respond and professional. Very organized and clean looking. Is extremely helpful for if you're trying to keep track of all the leads you're contacting and remembering to follow up on. Much more efficient than trying to keep them all in your head or on paper. Was also very simple to upload my lead list from Excel into Close. It is one of the  software programs I use most often for my business. 
I have worked in tech sales prior to starting my own company for which I am needing this software. I have used a few different CRMs during my sales career and some are extremely cluttered and old school. Out of all of them, Close is my personal favourite. What do you dislike about Close?Honestly I can't think of anything. Maybe the pricing is a little high for someone who is starting their business and trying to keep costs low, however it is well worth it and on par with other CRM pricing. I also have had experience using other CRM software so it was quite easy for me to pick up on how to use Close. Maybe people who are new to CRMs might find it a little more challenging, however out of all the ones available on the market, Close will still be their best bet for something that is user friendly and uncomplicated to learn. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Increases efficinecy substancially. Ensures that you keep track of all your leads and communications/follow ups.

title: "95% happy, but there's always little things to improve."
description:
What do you like best about Close?Very intuitive and easy to navigate - simple CRM tasks are clear.

Great to do sales outbound campaigns, especially as we do mostly cold emails.

Customer support is so good. Like really good.

Loom videos, good instructions and such good advice.

Support is the best part about close by far. What do you dislike about Close?Reporting functions could be better, especially as they only show sequence stats after they're completed (as opposed to live).

This is probably the most important thing as I am not data driven, making the data super easy would make me a better salesperson.

Will also send this to my partnerships lead as he's good a lot of feedback. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Following up email sales - we primarily do email sales which makes close the perfect platform.

Task management.

Note taking. Id love if I could link notes to contacts though, because sometimes we take notes but there's no link to a contact.

title: "4 years at Close - started as "very impressively smart helpful" and it keeps getting better"
description:
What do you like best about Close?Close is very impressive as it's..
very sleek, clean and chic yet
super well organized, with endless options which you never notice until you need it and its very nature helps you keep organized and moving forward.

You can get started in seconds and you'll know what you're doing without thinking about it. It has great tools for sending emails, keeping on top of clients, handling all parts of the sales process with just very well thought-out and pleasantly attractive set up of the whole thing

Best part is - amazing CS. Can email them direct from the CRM and get a response very quick. And they keep making it better. Many things you point out to them - you suddenly find have appeared in the CRM and many more that you didn''t.... What do you dislike about Close?only tiny gripe is that Inbox doesn't refresh itself or notify you when new email comes in so I have to keep using my Microsoft Inbox open the whole time when I'd love to just leave it and live in Close What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?helps me not lose a drop of what I've done or have to do... even though I can be a sloppy mess sometimes.

title: "Best CRM I've used in my 10 year sales career"
description:
What do you like best about Close?Close is the most effective tool I've used for contacting leads as soon as they come into our crm, staying on top of them as well with multiple touch points and then efficiently being organized to help with follow up.

It is also very good at tracking data to see what my team is doing on a day to day basis and also how we can better optimize our outreach.

Their support is also amazing and has helped me resolved anything I need in a timely manner.

They also have a feature where it's incredibly easy to find every conversation anyone in the organization has had. As a manager I use this everyday. What do you dislike about Close?Needs a better power dialer and a better reporting for organizing data on leads when it comes to dials and conversations for specific leads What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?They are building out a better system for organizing leads to better suite my company's needs and also helping me be more organized with delegating certain leads to certain sales reps as my team expands

title: "Keeps You Organized and Efficient"
description:
What do you like best about Close?All you leads in one space. Allows you to pull client data and call, email, text, communicate! 
Automatically prompts  various follow up fields and allows you to set your own as well. Once logged in you cal also search follow up by various fields, ex: you can set to "email" and it will show any emails you have not responded to What do you dislike about Close?Making outbound  calls while in Ap, I don't use this as I tend to call from another area but I do use a lot for direct email and it's great What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Keeps client follow up in front of me.

title: "Clean, easy and robust"
description:
What do you like best about Close?Everything is centralized throught the Inbox.  You can see emails received, SMS messages and tasks all in one place.  I also like you can customize almost everything: drip campaigns, activities and some automations.  As an investor, I have some custom fields that are important to my business such as Current Value, After Repair Value, zillow link, timeframe to close, mortgage balance, interest rate, liens/judgements and other fields.  I can create a standarized "Activity" box, so when I'm on calls with clients (which you can do through the app and have it recorded), you can click on Custom Activity =>  RE Discovery and all my fields pop up. 

Recorded phone conversaitons are great too.  I enjoy the ability to have phone conversations through the app and have it saved as a recording.  Last items I enjoy, as I scale and add members, it looks easy to assign tasks and different levels of access.

The data analysis/searching is wonderful.  I can search and create filters of searches on just about anything I want.  I can search by the date a contact was created, I can search by home price, date of sale, projected profit, etc... It's almost unlimited.

Lastly - it's nice to see a kanban outline as well as line view of clients and tasks.  Overall, Close is an easy to use CRM that is simple in U.I, but has robust features and customizations under the hood.  Very nice product. What do you dislike about Close?I wish there were some discounts for expanding.  There are other CRM's in my space that offer discounts as you add members, and as far as I know, if I have 3-4 members on the middle tier, it's the same $/month/user.  I also wish for drip campaigns, there was the ability to have an SMS or email go out within the first 2-3 minutes.  Close only allows automation by the hour.  Other than that, I can't think of any other issues/complaints. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close helps with organizing new and existing clients with a sales process.  I can see which clients have not been contacted, which clients have opened emails, which clients are a warm, cold or hot follow-up.  I can see who has a contract out and who is closed as well as projected profit.  Everything is in one place with drip campaigns of SMS and email.

title: "Close has replaced Highlevel as my favorite CRM."
description: What do you like best about Close?The dialer in close is one of the best I've ever used. I've been in sales since 2016 and i've used a ton of different CRMs and dialers. I also love that support helps with A2p registration. What do you dislike about Close?The one thing that I dislike the most is the lack of warm transfer for calls. I run a call center and warm live transfer are a huge part of my promise to clients. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?My biggest issue was finding a system that could do multi line dials as well as SMS/email marketing. Close does all of these very well.

title: "The best option for my startup"
description: What do you like best about Close?Huge amounts of upsides. Super cost-effective, flexible, plenty of capability even on the cheaper packages, VERY easy to use and intuitive, and the SmartViews are great. Very simple to implement, train new users and import leads. CS team get back extremely fast. What do you dislike about Close?There isn't much to dislike. There's a few feature requests I've shared with the team, mainly around fleshing out the workflows and automations. I'm looking forward to seeing upcoming releases! What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?We needed a cost-effective but capable CRM. We have many leads and contacts from a large TAM, so needed a CRM to help with organising, tracking, and staying on top of everything within the entire sales process. Starting with a very small team, the time saved with having everything I need in one place has allowed us to move far quicker and keep the team lean, with the compounding effect on saving $$$ on hiring.

title: "I am new to sales - I just graduated college."
description:
What do you like best about Close?Great interface that facilitates my work. I have no other experience with other software, but I really like using Close and i think it is a great program.

The AI summarization is also extremely helpful - it is better than I thought it would be. What do you dislike about Close?Texting comes across as green text. If there was a way to get close to work with iMessage, it would set this software apart from all others.

I have a grammarly account - if that could be linked to close whilst I send emails that would be stellar.

Maybe if you could get AI to help craft emails and how to phrase things internally that could be helpful What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It consildates lists of property owners in new york that I contact and it files all of their information in a digestable and condusive manner.

title: "Smooth, clean to use, easy and nice to work with."
description: What do you like best about Close?Close is a very good CRM it has great features and it is very simple to work with the automations and email systems are just perfect. I really like the power dialer it makes work smooth and easy. What do you dislike about Close?I experienced some technical issues with close here and there and it needs to be a little bit more reliable sometimes. Other than that I am happy with close and I would recommend it to every sales team out there What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close is Solving our problem with being a CRM that has great features, is reliable, and great to use when having a Sales Team with tracking stats having a great overview over leads sales pipeline etc.

title: "Amazing system for client management"
description: What do you like best about Close?As a leader in customer success, I've had the opportunity to work with various CRM platforms, and Close stands out for its efficiency and versatility. The platform excels at bringing together client data, calls, and SMS, making it an all-in-one solution for sales and communication management. The platform is really clean and organized, it ensures that you spend more time engaging with clients rather than learning the system. Tracking client interactions, from emails to calls, is seamless, and the detailed contact history helps ensure no information gets lost. It’s easy to filter leads, add notes, and keep the entire team on the same page. I usually know who to call, when to call and what to say thanks to Close. This app is ideal for teams who want an integrated solution that combines client data, calls, and SMS into one accessible platform. What do you dislike about Close?Nothing so far and to be completely honest I'm happy with the software and what it offers What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It is helping me keep track of the clients, the back-and-forth communications and improve our workflows.

title: "The cleanest and best software I have ever used."
description:
What do you like best about Close?It is the best software I have ever used. It is clean, fast, effecient, easy to use, and helps you keep track of every single lead you have. There are no more excuses for not following up with leads, because Close makes it impossible to not track your leads. The powerdialer is amazing, and the customer support is insanely quick and super helpful. After this I will never want to switch to another Sales CRM. 

It is insanely easy to use after watching a few quick tutorials, integrating leads is very quick and seamless, and I use this software literally every day to run my business. What do you dislike about Close?The calling costs are a bit high for me, but I also do many calls and I know the costs are similar to other softwares. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It helps me make a great amount of calls in short periods of time, always keep track of every lead and know what stage they are in to always know what to do when reaching out, and it's just very efficient in general.

title: "Feedback about Close as a developer"
description:

-never disconnected in working hours
-great API doc
-API endpoints work perfectly What do you dislike about Close?I could not think about a single thing I dislike in that system. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?It allows us to get contacted with 1000s of customers via email, phone, text. It allows to assign tasks to the users, track how effectively they call and speak with the customers.

title: "My Experience with Close CRM"
description:
What do you like best about Close?I like Close because it helps me manage all our clients very efficiently, allowing us to share the client database among team members and display all operations performed on a particular lead.
It is transparent, and all the emails in the inbox are shared with the team, which is essential for maintaining transparency within the team. We can also call clients directly using their stored phone numbers.
Close can be integrated with other software according to our needs and demands using its API key. It also offers very handy features such as custom fields, pipelines, and custom activities. What do you dislike about Close?I find that the import feature sometimes causes trouble because some fields are not assigned at the time of import. For example, unassigned columns need to be manually assigned. This can be done for CSV files with a small number of columns, but it becomes challenging when dealing with a large number of columns.
Another issue is that custom field IDs need to be changed every time you integrate Close with your software. These IDs vary with different Close account owners, which can complicate the integration process. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Close is solving several problems for us by:
Centralizing all lead details and operations in one application.
Providing a shared platform for the entire organization.
Allowing all team members to review and access information simultaneously.

These features benefit us by:
Improving organization and efficiency in managing leads.
Enhancing collaboration and transparency within the team.
Streamlining our workflow by having all necessary information in one place.
Reducing miscommunication and ensuring everyone has access to up-to-date information.

title: "An amazing CRM to enable sales"
description:
What do you like best about Close?The AI transcription and summary feature is a huge time saver. Not only does in ensure there is a note for every call made but ensures that all details are captured as sales reps often do not go deep enough when it comes to notes.
I also love the inbox view. Being able to see tasks, emails, SMS and missed calls all in one spot is great for organizing your day and ensuring speed to lead. What do you dislike about Close?That often when purchasing new phone numbers the numbers are already labelled as spam. Also, the phone billing is not by the second and that it rounds up to the narest dollar. What problems is Close solving and how is that benefiting you?Removing wasted time from sales reps day. This allows my team to stay focused on what they do best and do less admin work.
